definition: (of a surgeon) to perform an operation/(of a patient) to have an operation/to decapitate/to behead/to single out as a point of attack

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao

sentences.english: Worried your employer might cut your position in a downturn?
sentences.chinese: 担心在不景气的时候第一个被拿来开刀吗？

sentences.english: She had been operated on cholecystitis.
Patients tend to recover more quickly from such procedures than they would going under the knife.
sentences.chinese: 与开刀手术相比，接受此类手术的患者恢复速度更快。

sentences.english: I don't have a scar because the doctors operated on me with a laser.
sentences.chinese: 我没有留疤的原因是因为医生是用雷射帮我开刀的。

sentences.english: Since he had a heart attack, he protected his chest area.
sentences.chinese: 因为他是心脏开刀，所以他就报护胸前。

sentences.english: All four governors have caused a stir by taking on public-sector unions.
sentences.chinese: 四位州长都曾因拿政府公共部门工会开刀而引起风波。

sentences.english: Doctors give Trasylol to patients before surgery to reduce the risks of blood loss.
sentences.chinese: 医生在开刀前给患者使用该药来减少出血的风险。

sentences.english: This is the ultimate in one-hand openers.
sentences.chinese: 这是单手开刀的终极解决方案。

sentences.english: Intrahepatic bile duct stones have surgery surgery?
sentences.chinese: 肝内胆管结石必须开刀手术吗？

sentences.english: How's Sharon since her surgery last month?
sentences.chinese: 莎朗上个月开刀之后的状况怎么样？

sentences.english: Nobody will be laying off star salespeople.
sentences.chinese: 不会有人拿星级的营销员开刀的。

sentences.english: I'm used to it now. If only don't approved Peihua's operation.
sentences.chinese: 已经成了习惯了，当初我不答应给佩华开刀就好了。

definition: surgery
to kill/to get rid of/(sports) to defeat/to eliminate
to excise/to cut out (a tumor)
(surgical) operation/surgery/CL:個|个[ge4]
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
lit. kill one to warn a hundred (idiom); to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to pull out/to remove
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
lit. to kill a chicken in front of a monkey; fig. to make an example of sb (by punishment) to frighten others
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
to eliminate
making things awkward/to cause difficulties/to exert influence/to attract
to eradicate/to exterminate
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
